item.title: Alfred 4
item.description: What is Alfred? [Optimization/Tools/Alfred]] is an overlay (or alternative) for Spotlight. With a paid extension (PowerPack), it allows you to connect to, for example, [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] or [[Spotify]].

item.title: 1Password
item.description: What is 1Password? It is a paid password manager. From the perspective of online security, using the manager is very important.

item.title: AirBuddy
item.description: What is AirBuddy? AirBuddy is a simple app that makes it easy to manage AirPods headphones. I plugged in the keyboard shortcut responsible for connecting the headset under the Macbook, which made using them definitely more fun.

item.title: Airtable
item.description: What is Airtable? It’s a data storage application that resembles an Excel spreadsheet. Its biggest advantage is that it is built according to the [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] first approach, which works well in the context of [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]]

item.title: Anki
item.description: What is Anki? [Optimization/Tools/Anki]] is an application that facilitates memorization. It is based on the so-called [[Spaced Repetition]], which is repetition at intervals.

item.title: Arc
item.description: Arc is a web browser from The Browser Company and it looks like this: I have published two posts on [[Ahoy!

item.title: Audible
item.description: What is Audible? This is an app with Audiobooks, directly from Amazon. In my opinion, it is the best book listening app that exists on the market.

item.title: Automation
item.description: Every great software developer, for example, now has an army of robots working for him at nighttime while he or she sleeps, after they’ve written the code, and it’s cranking away.

item.title: Better Touch Tool
item.description: What is the Better Touch Tool? This is an application that allows you to set up advanced gestures on your trackpad.

item.title: Buffer
item.description: What is a Buffer? [[Optimization/Tools/Buffer]] is a service with the help of which I publish almost all posts in all social channels.

item.title: ClickUp
item.description: What is ClickUp? This is a powerful application for managing tasks in a team. I currently do not use it due to the fact that it offers much more capabilities than I need.

item.title: Cron
item.description: Cron is a calendar designed similarly to [[Optimization/Tools/Superhuman]], facilitating quick event planning and calendar management. https://cron.com/

item.title: Digital Ocean
item.description: This is the hosting I use for virtually every one of my projects. I also have a developer server that I use for learning and various types of testing.

item.title: Dropshare
item.description: This is an application that allows you to quickly upload screenshots and files to an FTP server. In my case, I am connecting to the VPS [[Optimization/Tools/Digital Ocean]].

item.title: Endel.io
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]] is an application that uses [AI] to generate sounds to help with focus, among other things. I reach for it almost every day.

item.title: Figma
item.description: This is currently one of the best interface design applications (if not the best). How do I use Figma? I usually use design systems, such as [[Systemflow]].

item.title: Framer Sites
item.description: This is a potential successor to [[Optimization/Tools/Webflow]]. I am currently watching the development of this project and treat it as a curiosity.

item.title: Hardware
item.description: Context When buying equipment, I take into account first and foremost how much it will affect my existing operation. I very much agree with the opinion of Greg Rog, which clearly shows that for professional use, it makes sense to choose the best available equipment that is within our financial reach and needs.

item.title: Hazel
item.description: [Optimization/Tools/Hazel]] is an application for automatic file organization. It allows you to define rules for individual folders. According to these rules, it is possible to rename according to certain schemes, move between folders or even run any [[Knowledge/Programming/JavaScript/JavaScript]] scripts.

item.title: Headphones
item.description: For me, headphones are an essential part of good [[Knowledge/Thoughts/Focus]], especially in combination with [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]], [[Optimization/Tools/Session]] and ANC (Active Noise Cancelling) technology.

item.title: Headspace
item.description: It’s an app for Mindfulness, breathing exercises and calming. I use it practically every day. Particularly noteworthy here is a quote by [[Knowledge/People/Ray Dalio]], according to whom transcendental meditation is one of the main reasons behind his success.

item.title: Hyper.is
item.description: It is a terminal created in HTML/CSS/JS. I like it a lot, but its performance is not satisfactory. Recently it was completely replaced by [[Warp.

item.title: iA Writer
item.description: It’s a markdown editor geared toward a minimalist interface and high focus when writing. How do I use iA Writer? In combination with [[Optimization/Tools/Session]] and [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.

item.title: Intellij
item.description: What is IntelliJ? It’s an IDE created by JetBrains that, in my opinion, is the best tool for developers, and I find it hard to explain why so many people still use Visual Studio Code.

item.title: iPad
item.description: The iPad is, in my opinion, one of the best pieces of electronic music I have ever encountered. Applications [[Optimization/Tools/Kindle]] - if I have a tablet with me, I read on it [[Optimization/Tools/Notability]] - I keep a [[Foundations/📓 Journal]] almost every day just on the iPad using the Apple Pencil [[Optimization/Tools/Procreate]] - in my spare time and on trips I draw In addition, I have virtually no applications installed on the iPad other than those mentioned above.

item.title: iPhone
item.description: For the past few years, my main phone has been an iPhone and I find it hard to imagine going back to Android or alternatives.

item.title: Karabiner
item.description: …

item.title: Keyboard Maestro
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] is an application I use to automate many tasks within the OSX operating system. I use it together with [[Raycast]] and [[Better Touch Tool]].

item.title: Kindle
item.description: This is the application in which I read all [[Knowledge/Books/Books]] on both [[Optimization/Hardware/iPhone]] and [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]]. Most of the quotes I publish are just from the highglights marked in this application.

item.title: Macbook
item.description: Context MacBook is the most important work tool for me. For years I worked on Windows but since I bought my first MacBook, I can’t imagine going back.

item.title: Magnet
item.description: This is a window manager that I use together with [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] to organize my work on [[Optimization/Hardware/Macbook]]. An alternative is Mosaic, available in the Setapp package.

item.title: MakeHQ
item.description: Make is the most important automation tool I use. With it, I connect all services that have [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] using either built-in modules or connecting directly through [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] via the HTTP module.

item.title: Matter
item.description: …

item.title: Microservices
item.description: Generating graphics Initially, for my own purposes, I designed a microservice that generates optimized creatives based on a special template. Later, the project was extended to a module in [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] and is now available to others under the name [[Projects/EasyBanner]].

item.title: MindNode
item.description: This is the best mindmapping application I know of available for [[macOS]].

item.title: Notability
item.description: This is a note-taking app designed for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]]. I’ve been using it since 2017 and I keep my [[Foundations/Journal]] in it.

item.title: Notion
item.description: This is a note-taking application, which is now an extensive tool in which I organize all my projects. Its biggest advantage is access to [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] and the ability to connect with [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] and [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] to create your own [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]].

item.title: Oak
item.description: This is a free app for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]] that I use to implement my [[Foundations/Process]] and specifically stress-reducing breathing exercises. I use it in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Headspace]] (not simultaneously)

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: What is Obsidian? Simply put, it’s a note-taking application. Its main advantages are that it works on local [[markdown]] files and allows connections between notes through so-called ‘wiki links’.

item.title: Onyx
item.description: This is an application for [[macOS]] that I run once every few months to clean the system of unnecessary items.

item.title: Optimization
item.description: [[Foundations/Process]] [[Optimization/Hardware/Hardware]] [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]] [[Optimization/Tools/Tools]]

item.title: Paste
item.description: This is the best clipboard manager for [[macOS]] that I know of. It saves the history of system clipboard changes and allows easy searching.

item.title: Procreate
item.description: This is an application for [[Optimization/Hardware/iPad]] in which I draw as a hobby and create elements for videos for [[Projects/overment]] or [[Projects/eduweb]].

item.title: Raycast
item.description: Raycast is a launcher that has almost entirely replaced [[Optimization/Tools/Alfred]] and largely replaces [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]]. Its biggest advantage for me is:

item.title: Reveri
item.description: Reveri is an application recommended by [[Knowledge/People/Andrew Huberman]] for self-hypnosis. I use it in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Headspace]] and [[Optimization/Tools/Oak]].

item.title: Rize
item.description: Rize is an application that works similarly to RescueTime. Running in the background, it monitors activities on your computer and measures the time spent in particular applications/websites.

item.title: Rocket
item.description: Rocket is an emoji picker for [[macOS]]. I use it because it works much faster than the system picker.

item.title: Scenarios
item.description: Publishing posts on Social Media I publish most of the posts with the help of [[Optimization/Tools/Buffer]] to which the data goes automatically from [[Optimization/Tools/Airtable]] thanks to [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]].

item.title: Screenflow
item.description: Screenflow is a screen recording application that I use to record and edit screencasts.

item.title: Sendgrid
item.description: Sendgrid is the best email system I know of, which I use by automating [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] and [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]].

item.title: Session
item.description: Session is a pomodoro session application that I use in parallel with [[Optimization/Tools/Endel.io]] to focus on my work (deep work - read more: [[Knowledge/Books/Deep Work]])

item.title: Slack
item.description: It’s a communicator I use in my day-to-day work but also in [[Optimization/Automation/Automation]] with [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]], where my robot team reports to me in real time on activities undertaken and in some situations communicates asking me to take specific actions.

item.title: Stream Deck
item.description: What is StreamDeck? Elgato StreamDeck is a kind of auxiliary keyboard, on the keys of which you can display any graphics, including dynamic ones (automatic replacement of photo and description).

item.title: Superhuman
item.description: Czym jest Superhuman? Superhuman is a great email client focused on high efficiency through support for keyboard shortcuts and a superbly optimized UI.

item.title: Tools
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] MakeHQ (formerly Integromat) is the best platform I know for easily connecting services through [[Knowledge/Programming/API]]. Its most important features are webhooks, an http module that allows you to connect to any application, and a great API that I use for my own extensions.

item.title: Tools
item.description: [[Optimization/Tools/Arc]] - web browser [[Optimization/Tools/Airtable]] - API first excel na sterydach [[Optimization/Tools/MakeHQ]] - The best tool for automating and quickly combining [[Knowledge/Programming/API]] [[Optimization/Tools/Keyboard Maestro]] - Automations in OSX [[Optimization/Tools/Romwod]] - Application with stretching exercise program [[Optimization/Tools/Raycast]] - Launcher w którym tworzę własne rozszerzenia w [[Knowledge/Programming/Node.
